title: Extend `init` to optionally scaffold placeholder outputs
scope: Add an optional mode to `fusbal-pipeline init` to scaffold placeholder output files (JSON/JSONL) matching the V1 contract.
Keep placeholders explicitly marked as placeholders and safe for demos/tests.
Do not generate fake detections/events; placeholders should be minimal and obviously synthetic/empty.
acceptance: `init` supports a flag (e.g. `--with-placeholders`) that creates placeholder artifacts referenced by the bundle layout.
A bundle created with placeholders passes `validate` with exit code 0 (no warnings model is introduced in this task).
Placeholder contents are deterministic and minimal-but-valid for each format (e.g. empty `.jsonl`, `events.json` as `[]`, `report.json` as `{}`, and `report.html` as a minimal HTML skeleton).

deliverables.title: Placeholder scaffold logic integrated into CLI init
acceptance: Placeholder creation is gated behind an explicit flag.
Placeholder contents are minimal, deterministic, and clearly labeled.
evidence: `fusbal-pipeline init --with-placeholders ...` creates a bundle that can be validated.
Generated placeholder files are byte-for-byte identical across repeated runs.

subtasks.title: Define the placeholder artifact set and minimal placeholder contents for V1 bundle artifacts.
done_when: Placeholder files are defined explicitly and map to required bundle artifacts.
Placeholders are clearly labeled and contain minimal valid structure.

subtasks.title: Add CLI flag and implementation to emit placeholders during `init`.
done_when: `init` supports a flag to enable placeholder generation.
Placeholder generation is deterministic and does not overwrite existing files unexpectedly.
